message.content:
cs.RO, cs.HC, cs.LG, cs.SY, cs.AI. 

The paper focuses on the development and evaluation of a hybrid shared control robot for enhancing task learning through forceful interaction. This falls under the domain of robotics (cs.RO) as it involves physical human-robot interaction. Additionally, the paper discusses the features of the shared control paradigm that promote successful training, which relates to human-computer interaction (cs.HC). The evaluation of the proposed approach involves human subject studies, which could fall under machine learning (cs.LG) or systems and control (cs.SY). Finally, the paper mentions the use of an evaluation criterion for selectively accepting or rejecting user inputs, which could involve artificial intelligence (cs.AI).
